Experience working in a SaaS subscription business is strongly preferred.

description: Job Duties: - Check for new packing slips and receive them into QuickBooks daily (weekdays). - Communicate with receiving department via email if there are discrepancies. - Communicate with purchasing department via email if damage claims or missing shipments occur. 1-3 hours per week. Must be familiar with QuickBooks Enterprise software and Google products.
title: Data Entry - Receiving Packing Slips into QuickBooks Enterprise

description: Company Overview: The Washington Informer is a trusted local news source that has served the community for nearly six decades. As we approach our 60th anniversary, we continue to uphold our commitment to delivering impactful journalism that informs, educates, and empowers our readers. We are seeking an experienced and detail-oriented Accounts Receivable Specialist to join our finance team and help us continue our mission. Position Summary:The Accounts Receivable Specialist manages the organization’s accounts receivable process, ensuring accurate and timely payment collection from clients and customers. This role involves working closely with various departments to resolve billing issues, maintain accurate records, and ensure that all receivables are collected within the agreed-upon terms. Key Responsibilities: Invoice Management: Generate and distribute accurate invoices to customers and clients promptly. Payment Processing: Record and process incoming payments and posted promptly and correctly. Account Reconciliation: Reconcile the accounts receivable ledger to ensure all payments are accounted for and correctly posted. Collections: Monitor accounts to identify outstanding debts, initiate collection activities, and follow up with customers on overdue payments. Customer Relations: Serve as customers’ primary point of contact regarding billing inquiries, disputes, and payment arrangements. Reporting: Prepare and present regular reports on accounts receivable status, including aging reports and cash flow projections. Compliance: Ensure compliance with financial policies and procedures, as well as relevant regulations and standards. Qualifications: Education: Bachelor’s degree in Accounting or related fields, or at least 8+ years of experience in accounts receivable or a similar role, preferably in the media or publishing industry. Skills: Proficiency in GAAP and accounting software. Proficiency in accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, etc.) and Microsoft Office Suite, particularly Excel. Excellent organizational and time management skills. Strong attention to detail, accuracy and analytical skills. Ability to handle sensitive information with confidentiality. Excellent communication and customer service skills. Ability to work independently and as part of a team. Additional Information: Work Environment: This position offers a hybrid work environment with both in-office and remote work opportunities.
title: Accounts Receivable Specialist

description: Description: We are seeking an experienced consultant to help us conduct a thorough audit of our current systems, tools, and vendor relationships. The goal of this project is to gain a clear understanding of our operational landscape, identify opportunities for optimization, and create a roadmap for more efficient system utilization. The selected consultant will be responsible for: Audit and Mapping: Documenting all current vendors, tools, systems, and software in use. Identifying the number of licenses and/or credits associated with each tool. Mapping out how these tools interact and integrate with one another. Compiling data on costs, usage, and renewal dates for all systems. Analysis and Recommendations: Providing a detailed analysis of redundancies, inefficiencies, or underutilized tools. Recommending which systems or tools should be retained, replaced, consolidated, or eliminated. Outlining the cost implications of these recommendations (e.g., savings, investment needed). Providing a clear rationale for each recommendation, supported by data and insights. Deliverables: A comprehensive vendor and system map with associated costs, renewal dates, and utilization levels. A detailed recommendation report with proposed changes, rationale, and cost implications. An actionable roadmap for implementing the recommended changes. Ideal Candidate: We are looking for someone with: Proven experience in systems audits, vendor management, and operational consulting. Strong analytical and organizational skills to map out complex systems and vendors. Excellent communication skills to present findings and recommendations clearly. Familiarity with SaaS tools, licenses, integrations, and renewal management. Ability to assess cost impacts and articulate the value of recommendations.
title: Systems and Vendor Mapping Consultant

description: Description: Futuralis is looking for a proactive and technically adept Software Sales Engineer specialized in AWS to drive the acquisition of new AWS-based application development projects. This role involves identifying potential clients, understanding their requirements for AWS solutions, and positioning our company as their trusted partner. You will leverage your technical understanding of AWS services and sales expertise to deliver customized proposals, build strong client relationships, and generate business growth. Key Responsibilities: - Identify and engage with clients looking to build or migrate applications on AWS. - Develop strategies to generate leads through networking, partnerships, and outreach, focusing on AWS-related projects. -Collaborate with clients to understand their business needs and propose tailored AWS-based solutions. - Work closely with technical teams to create compelling bids and RFP responses for AWS application development projects. -Educate clients on AWS services and how they can optimize their applications through our expertise. - Monitor AWS trends, market opportunities, and competitor strategies to identify potential project opportunities. - Build long-term relationships by ensuring client satisfaction and acting as a trusted advisor for their AWS needs. - Maintain records of sales activities, including leads, opportunities, and project pipelines. Required Skills and Qualifications: - Proven experience in software sales or business development with a focus on AWS projects. - Strong knowledge of AWS services, including EC2, S3, Lambda, RDS, DynamoDB, Step Functions, and other cloud-based solutions. - Ability to translate client requirements into tailored AWS solutions that align with their business goals. - Excellent communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills. - Experience with lead generation strategies, bidding platforms, and sales lifecycle management. - Results-oriented mindset with the ability to work independently and drive projects to completion. Preferred Qualifications: - AWS certifications (e.g., AWS Cloud Practitioner/AWS Solutions Architect). - Experience in selling or consulting on AWS-based application development projects.
title: Software Sales Engineer (AWS Specialist) - US Only - Remote

description: Our company performs public record searches to procure real estate property tax records. We compile the data and deliver a report for a property or group of properties to our clients. This is unstructured data that we structure. We seek a skilled and forward-thinking Senior Software Developer to join our team on a contract basis to assist to maintain and optimize our current legacy application, built with C# and Web Forms. The candidate shall also evaluate its architecture to form the basis for a complete rebuild using a modern AI-enabled utilities for data extraction. The resulting application is expected to reduce repetitive tasks, improve workflows, and integrate AI-enabled document extraction utilities to enhance productivity and reduce liability. Job Title - Senior Software Developer and System Evaluator Location - [USA] Employment Type - Contract Job Overview - Seeking a skilled developer to: - Maintain and optimize a legacy application (C#, Web Forms). - Evaluate its architecture for a rebuild using modern frameworks. - Integrate AI document extraction utilities tools to improve workflows, reduce repetitive tasks, and minimize liability. Key Responsibilities - Maintenance and Minor Updates - Oversee and maintain the current legacy application, ensuring stability. - Implement minor code changes and bug fixes. - System Evaluation - Conduct a comprehensive evaluation of current architecture for inefficiencies. - Design and recommend migration strategies to modern frameworks. - Development of Future Applications - Develop a scalable, AI-enabled application with document extraction tools. - Collaborate with stakeholders to create efficient workflows. - Documentation and Knowledge Transfer - Document build processes, deployment guides, and architecture diagrams. - Technical Support - Provide support, troubleshoot issues, and uphold security protocols. Qualifications - Technical Skills - Proficiency in C#, ASP.NET, Web Forms, and Blazor Framework (.NET 8). - Experience with SQL Server and schema design. - Familiarity with SVN, Git, and branching strategies. - Knowledge of AI/ML tools for document extraction. - Familiarity with Docker and CI/CD pipelines. - Process Expertise - Skilled in migrating legacy applications. - Experience in automated builds, testing frameworks, and deployment pipelines. - Soft Skills - Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. - Excellent communication skills. Why Join Us? - Lead the modernization of critical applications. - Work with cutting-edge technologies, including AI. - Collaborate with a forward-thinking and innovative team. Compensation - Competitive salary/contract rate based on experience.
title: DevXpress, C#, and AI Developer

description: We’re on a mission to revolutionize the $30 billion Oil Change industry with the ultimate mobile software—something that’s never been done before. We know exactly what we need, and now we’re searching for you to help us bring this game-changing vision to life. If you’re someone who thrives on building something extraordinary, who wants to have fun while doing it, and who dreams big enough to become a true partner (50/50) in this groundbreaking venture, we want to talk to you. This isn’t just another software project. The mobile Oil Change industry is waiting for its hero product—software that does it all. Right now, businesses are stuck using two or three different platforms just to manage their operations. We’re here to change that. We’re here to create the first all-in-one mobile Oil Change software that’s intuitive, powerful, and built for success. We’re on the path to becoming the #1 mobile automotive service in America, and you could be a part of that journey. If you’re the kind of person who jumps at the chance to solve real problems, disrupt an industry, and create something incredible, this is your moment. We don’t need just anyone—we need a rockstar. Are you ready to help us redefine an industry? Let’s build something amazing together. This software isn’t just a tool—it’s a goldmine of potential. Not only will it power our current operation and future franchises, but it’s also poised to revolutionize dozens of franchises we plan to sell. With the right vision and execution, this platform could evolve into a lucrative subscription-based service, a licensable solution, and even a standout product that gets noticed across the tech and automotive industries. If we do this right, we won’t just dominate the Oil Change market—we’ll create something so versatile, it could easily crossover into other service industries, expanding its impact and value exponentially. Let’s make this happen.
title: Software engineer

description: Need recruiter to find an amazing hard working Senior Backend Software Engineer in the Orange County area of California. This just is 100% in the office, no remote work or hybrid. If you can help find us the candidate great, but again no remote work or hybrid. Please apply and I will send you the job description.
title: Recruiter for Senior Backend Software Engineer

description: About Us: We are a premier medical spa specializing in advanced facial rejuvenation treatments and skincare solutions. As our business grows, we’re looking for a skilled and motivated Appointment Setter to join our team. If you have a proven track record in sales, follow scripts with precision, and thrive in a fast-paced environment, we want to hear from you! Key Responsibilities: Contact potential clients via phone, email, and text to schedule consultations and treatments. Follow structured scripts to engage leads professionally and effectively. Address objections confidently and persuasively to secure appointments. Maintain accurate and up-to-date records of calls, appointments, and follow-ups in our CRM. Collaborate with the team to meet or exceed booking goals. Represent our medical spa with enthusiasm, professionalism, and a deep understanding of our services. Requirements: Native English speaker (required). Formal sales training with proven experience in appointment setting or sales roles. Strong verbal and written communication skills. Ability to follow scripts while keeping the conversation engaging and natural. Highly organized, with attention to detail and excellent time management skills. Proficient in CRM software and scheduling tools. Positive, self-motivated, and able to handle objections and rejection professionally. Preferred Qualifications: Experience in the beauty, medical spa, or wellness industries. Familiarity with aesthetic treatments like Botox, fillers, and microneedling. Understanding of client objections in the medical spa industry and effective objection-handling techniques. What We Offer: Competitive pay with performance-based incentives. Flexible work schedule. Opportunities for growth in the thriving medical spa industry. A supportive team environment with ongoing training and development.
title: Appointment Setter

At a high level: Swapping out base tables ETL changes as required add additional data tests as needed.
title: Microservices Snowflake Migration

description: Position Overview We're seeking a skilled video editor to transform our video marketing into polished case studies, product showcase videos, training materials, social media content, and more. This role focuses on post-production expertise to convert Zoom recordings into engaging, professional video content for multiple purposes and develop sleek videos curated for Truv’s audiences, both B2B and B2C. Key Deliverables 1. Case Study Videos o Transform webinar conversations into compelling customer stories o Create structured narrative edits from Zoom recordings o Highlight key success metrics and outcomes 2. Product Videos o Create product demonstrations and overviews o Create feature highlight reels o Structure technical demonstrations for clarity 3. Training Materials o Create focused tutorial segments o Develop step-by-step guides from demonstrations o Package technical sessions into digestible formats 4. Social Media Content o Extract LinkedIn-optimized clips from case studies o Create short-form highlights from longer content o Develop engagement-focused video snippets Key Responsibilities • Edit and enhance webinar recordings • Create compelling narratives from conversation-style recordings • Add professional graphics, transitions, key callouts, subtitles and text overlays • Design engaging motion graphics to enhance content • Incorporate brand elements and style guidelines • Optimize audio quality from webinar recordings • Create multiple edits of varying lengths from source material • Ensure consistency across all deliverables • Ideate and create branded videos to enhance Truv’s mission Required Qualifications • 3+ years of video editing experience • Proven expertise in transforming long-form content into engaging videos • Advanced proficiency in video editing software (e.g., Adobe Premiere Pro, After Effects) • Experience with motion graphics and text animation • Understanding of social media video requirements • Excellence in narrative structure and pacing Technical Skills • Advanced video editing • Motion graphics creation • Audio enhancement and cleanup • Text animation • Graphic design integration • Format optimization • Multi-platform delivery • Sound mixing and enhancement Software Requirements • Professional video editing suite • Motion graphics software • Audio editing capabilities • Asset management system • High-performance editing workstation Project Expectations • Quick turnaround capabilities • Typical projects range from 2-4 days • Available for feedback and revisions • Ability to handle multiple projects simultaneously • Understanding of business and technical content Compensation • $45-70/hour, based on experience • Project-based work with no retainer • Contractor position (1099)
title: Video Editor Contractor

description: About Valiant: ‎ ‎ Valiant is a full-service content creation and digital marketing agency for service businesses in the trading, reselling, sports betting, and e-commerce niches. Our clients include some of the largest companies in the online side-hustle niche including Whop.com, one of the largest digital marketplace in the world. Our current offerings include short-form video creation, email marketing, and paid advertising, among others. Over the next 12 months we have plans to expand and as a result are looking to hire additional marketing staff in our paid ads, social media, and email marketing teams. Our vision is to be the go-to marketing agency for all types of services that help people make money online. We are already very well known in the sports betting and reselling niches however are looking to venture much further into niches we’re less known in and build a market-wide reputation for ruthlessly outperforming other marketers in the space. Compensation & Perks: 💸 $4,000 to $6,000 in monthly starting salary. 📈 Up to $8k in monthly salary based on initial 90-day performance. 🌎 Full-time remote-based position with flexible working hours. ✈️ Flights, US visa sponsorship, and accommodation for team meetups. Job Responsibilities: – Automate our company operations and work with the Monday.com API – Implementing and optimizing pre-made website designs on WordPress, Webflow, or Framer. – Writing scripts to scrape websites for potential future sales leads. – Leading and advising our website designer and setting a good example in and outside of work. – Maintaining existing Discord bots and existing websites made on WordPress. Required Qualifications: – Experienced with the Monday.com API, Zapier and Make.com – 1 or more years of experience as a software engineer. – Willing to commit to working full-time exclusively for our company (cannot be in school, running your own business, or working other jobs). – Experience with the following technologies: HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. – Preferably experience with Wordpress, Webflow or Framer, or other CMS. - Ability to make scripts and automation that can scrape websites for data. – Capable of turning website mock-ups and designs into code. – Capable of making websites responsive and mobile optimized. Preferred Qualifications: – Experience with integrating 3rd party APIs (Stripe API, etc) – Experience with Material UI / Material Design. – Experience with UI/UX design tools such as Figma and Adobe. – Previous experience starting a business or experience working at smaller companies/startups. – Bachelors or Masters in computer science, computer engineering, electrical engineering, or equivalent experience. – Knowledge, or interest in sports betting, trading, reselling, online selling, or e-commerce. Who We Need: – You’ve got positive energy. You’re optimistic about the future and determined to get there. – You are looking for an exciting opportunity that isn’t just about the money. – You’re comfortable with agile workflow and are quick to iterate. – You work well with direct, rapid, and candid feedback. – You’re both an active communicator and an eager listener. – You’re passionate about software development and have high standards for your code. – You are willing to take 100% responsibility for your code. – You’re willing to go outside of your comfort zone and you’re up for new challenges. – You are a very hard-working and driven person, and are flexible with your work days/hours. – You have a winners mindset. You want to win and you’re not satisfied with the status quo. – You are comfortable with startup culture. It’s casual, and not corporate, but is demanding.
title: Full Stack Websites and Automations Engineer (Must have experience with the Monday.com API)

description: We are looking for an outstanding Web Developer to be responsible for the coding, innovative design and layout of our client's websites. Depending on the engagement you will help build client websites from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and function. Responsibilities Depending on the engagement you will help build client websites from concept all the way to completion from the bottom up, fashioning everything from the home page to site layout and function You should be well versed in responsive design, able to write clean code, and ensure your programs run properly Produce well designed, testable, efficient code by using best software development practices Build website layout/user interface by using responsive HTML/CSS practices Utilize data from various back-end services and databases Collect and review specifications and requirements based on technical needs Prepare and maintain software documentation Maintain, expand, and scale our site as assigned Keep up-to-date with emerging technologies and industry trends and apply them into operations and activities Work together with web designers to match visual design intent
title: Web Developer specialists needed to create platform for brand awareness

description: We are a brand new start up company looking to utilize Zoho One for our billing team. We work in restoration insurance billing and want to customize Zoho to fit our needs. We have a rough draft in a free version of Zoho that a friend of a friend of a friend created that we need to have duplicated into Zoho One and added to for the features we need. We would like this done with in 2 weeks or ready to go at the beginning of January.
title: Set up Zoho One

description: We are seeking an experienced Power BI developer to create an inventory management dashboard. The ideal candidate will be skilled in designing interactive and visually appealing dashboards that effectively track inventory levels, sales, and trends. The dashboard should provide real-time insights and be user-friendly for our team to utilize. Previous experience with inventory management systems and data visualization is essential. Please share your portfolio showcasing similar projects you've completed in the past. The purpose of this project is to create an Inventory Control dashboard that allows buyers to make strategic stock orders based on usage, lead time, and buying discounts. The following scope of work is the minimum of what the dashboard should be capable of doing. Our existing ERP software (Field Servio) provides access to data tables via SQL server. The information should refresh automatically a minimum of once per day. Ideally the information would refresh in real time throughout the day. We understand that the solution will require software subscriptions (Power BI, fabric, or Tableau, etc.); the end product should not require any reoccurring consultant labor to refresh or maintain the connection to the source data. The finished product will be the sole intellectual property of Associated Compressor & Equipment LLC with no royalties or licensing fees other than the software subscriptions mentioned above. • Breakdown all inventory items by North, Central, and South warehouses. Give the Buyer the option to look at items by individual warehouses and also to roll the totals up into a consolidated total. Some part numbers will be stocked in multiple warehouses. • Calculate the Average Monthly Usage (AMU) and Average Daily Usage (ADU) by Warehouse based on a rolling six month sales average • Calculate the average lead time of an item by looking at the time between when each PO was placed and when the line items were received. Average these values over a rolling 6-month historical period. • Allow a “Safety Stock” quantity to be assigned to each item in each warehouse. • Calculate an “Order Point” using the formula below and display this value for each item in each warehouse. Allow these values to roll-up into a consolidated total for each item. o Order Point = (Lead Time * ADU) + Safety Stock • Calculate a “Net Available” quantity for each item in each warehouse using the formula below. Allow these values to roll-up into a consolidated total for each item. o Net Available = On Hand – Committed – Backordered + On Order • Calculate a Recommended Order Quantity whenever the Net Available is less than the Order Point. • Create a user interface Dashboard that allows the buyer to do the following: o Filter items by Vendor, Warehouse, Item Type, Item Category, and Product Line. o Sort and filter items by Cost, AMU, ADU, Average Lead Time, Safety Stock, Order Point, Net Available, and Recommended Order Quantity. o Allow the buyer to select items to include on the next PO and export the list of items and quantities to a template that the ERP software can import to produce the actual PO for the vendor. o Display the total dollar value and total quantity of the selected items so the Buyer can “build” the purchase order before exporting it.
title: Power BI Inventory Management Dashboard Development

description: We are looking for an experienced Tableau developer to build a comprehensive inventory management dashboard. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in data visualization and inventory analytics. You will be responsible for transforming raw inventory data into insightful visual representations that will help our team make informed decisions. If you have a keen eye for detail and can create user-friendly interfaces, we would love to hear from you. Please include examples of previous Tableau dashboards in your application. The purpose of this project is to create an Inventory Control dashboard that allows buyers to make strategic stock orders based on usage, lead time, and buying discounts. The following scope of work is the minimum of what the dashboard should be capable of doing. Our existing ERP software (Field Servio) provides access to data tables via SQL server. The information should refresh automatically a minimum of once per day. Ideally the information would refresh in real time throughout the day. We understand that the solution will require software subscriptions (Power BI, fabric, or Tableau, etc.); the end product should not require any reoccurring consultant labor to refresh or maintain the connection to the source data. The finished product will be the sole intellectual property of Associated Compressor & Equipment LLC with no royalties or licensing fees other than the software subscriptions mentioned above. • Breakdown all inventory items by North, Central, and South warehouses. Give the Buyer the option to look at items by individual warehouses and also to roll the totals up into a consolidated total. Some part numbers will be stocked in multiple warehouses. • Calculate the Average Monthly Usage (AMU) and Average Daily Usage (ADU) by Warehouse based on a rolling six month sales average • Calculate the average lead time of an item by looking at the time between when each PO was placed and when the line items were received. Average these values over a rolling 6-month historical period. • Allow a “Safety Stock” quantity to be assigned to each item in each warehouse. • Calculate an “Order Point” using the formula below and display this value for each item in each warehouse. Allow these values to roll-up into a consolidated total for each item. o Order Point = (Lead Time * ADU) + Safety Stock • Calculate a “Net Available” quantity for each item in each warehouse using the formula below. Allow these values to roll-up into a consolidated total for each item. o Net Available = On Hand – Committed – Backordered + On Order • Calculate a Recommended Order Quantity whenever the Net Available is less than the Order Point. • Create a user interface Dashboard that allows the buyer to do the following: o Filter items by Vendor, Warehouse, Item Type, Item Category, and Product Line. o Sort and filter items by Cost, AMU, ADU, Average Lead Time, Safety Stock, Order Point, Net Available, and Recommended Order Quantity. o Allow the buyer to select items to include on the next PO and export the list of items and quantities to a template that the ERP software can import to produce the actual PO for the vendor. o Display the total dollar value and total quantity of the selected items so the Buyer can “build” the purchase order before exporting it.
title: Tableau Dashboard Development for Inventory Management

description: We are a small NYC contracting company (manual labor, less than 5 employees) looking to setup our payroll system for the first time. ------------------ We are looking for someone who can advise us on the following: 1) Worker classification as 1099 vs. W2 employee 2) Best practices & software recommendation for setting up payroll 3) Staying compliant in the right taxes, benefits, insurance, etc in NYC ------------------ We are also looking for help in terms of general accounting and book-keeping best practices, including managing sales tax and multiple business locations across the Tri-State area.
title: Payroll / HR Advisor for NYC Small Business

description: Skills and Experience Overview: An ownership mentality—of an entire codebase Extreme competency in Python (Flask), JavaScript (React) and Postgres. Deep experience with LLMs and RAG mechanisms Strong Microsoft Azure experience Communicative to a fault About Tellen: Tellen builds enterprise AI infrastructure that empowers accounting firms to deploy secure, compliant generative AI solutions for their employees and clients. Role Overview: We are seeking a highly skilled engineer with a minimum of five years’ experience in full stack development and expertise in: Backend Development: Advanced proficiency in Python (Flask) and database management (Postgres), including testing, migrations, and optimization of database queries. Frontend Development: Strong experience with React and TailwindCSS for building user interfaces. The ability to mimic a Figma design. Cloud Infrastructure: Proficiency in Azure, including networking, security, infrastructure-as-code, and CI/CD practices via GitHub Actions. AI Integration: Hands-on experience with LLMs through APIs, as well as developing and implementing mechanisms for Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) and using other AI models such as Document Intelligence for data extraction. Additional Qualifications: Prioritization & Agility: The ideal candidate is agile and knows how to prioritize and consistently meets deadlines without compromising on quality. They should begin tasks with the biggest bang-for-buck elements before moving onto edge cases. Communication: Exceptional written and verbal communication skills are essential for effective collaboration and creating clear, detailed documentation. Including a video walkthrough of a past project in your application is highly encouraged. Architectural Input: Ability to make architectural and design decisions while balancing product goals with well-structured, maintainable code. Flexible Hiring Arrangement: We are happy to bring new talent on board as consultants for 10-15 hours a week to get to know one another. This arrangement allows for a mutual evaluation period before transitioning to a full-time role. This is preferred to algorithm tests, etc. Preferred Background: A Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Mathematics, Engineering, Physics, Computer Science, or at least five years’ experience in software engineering is preferred but not required. What We Offer: Competitive salary and equity options Opportunity to be a founding team member of an early stage startup on track to revolutionize the accounting and audit industry Flexible working hours and remote work capabilities Access to mentorship in both technical and business areas, with an allocated budget for personal and professional development Comprehensive health insurance or healthcare stipend
title: Senior Full Stack Software and AI Engineer

description: Seeking Technical Co-Founder for AI-Driven Education Platform I am building a platform delivering tailored, high-quality study materials for a specialized education niche. The project is in its early stages and requires a skilled full-stack web developer. You will take the lead on the technical side of the project, with responsibilities including: • UI/UX Design. • Full-Stack Development • Implementing and customizing an AI model tailored to the project's vision • Secure Payment Gateway Integration I’m looking for someone to join me in bringing this vision to life. In return, we can negotiate a revenue share agreement or an ownership stake in the project if we decide to move forward. Please send your resume, LinkedIn profile, and any relevant portfolio examples for consideration. Preferred Background: Engineers and software developers, or candidates with a law degree who are proficient in web development.
title: Equity Stake in an AI-Powered Education Platform for Niche Industry: Seeking a Web Developer

description: This project involves migrating an existing .NET C# web application platform from one AWS account to a fresh account. The current platform is hosted primarily on AWS and offers software for purchase via Stripe, which communicates via API to download and license the applications from an AWS EC2 instance. The key aspects of the migration involve reconfiguring the EC2 instances, databases, authentication processes, domain names and routing in the new AWS account. Additionally, the third party transactional email service needs to be replaced with an AWS hosted SES solution to improve integration and security. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience architecting and migrating .NET based web platforms between AWS accounts while updating supporting services like email and payments systems. The goal is to make the platform fully hosted and managed within AWS to simplify ongoing management and support. Note I do not have the current AWS Key as it was not shared by the previous developer who is now unavailable.
title: Experienced .NET/AWS Developer

description: Allego is a Sales Enablement Platform that uses the power of mobile technology to ensure teams can quickly create and share interactive content to train, reinforce, onboard, coach, and drive productivity anywhere, anytime. Our Customer Success team is seeking a detail-oriented individual familiar with complex systems to help execute various tasks. You will work directly with the Manager of Support & Operations and will be assigned various scoped projects to help our internal teams service our customers. This posting is for one specific project that requires video editing, but depending on performance, there is an opportunity for future projects. Skills/Experience required: 1. Navigating complex systems 2. Familiarity with Google Suite 3. Attention to detail 4. Clear communication 5. Quick learner and execution of assigned tasks 6. Video editing software Work will directly consist of: 1. Editing larger mp4s into smaller pieces and uploading to a specified location 2. Using our software to create quizzes 3. Navigating a complex platform If you have experience doing these kinds of tasks, we want to hear from you! In your application, please submit a detailed explanation of your most relevant experience and why you are a good candidate for this role. Portfolios are a plus!
title: Break .mp4 videos into smaller pieces + Navigate and upload content to our platform

title: QuickBooks Online Account Reconciliation for 2024

description: I am looking for an experienced app developer with expertise in Adalo to build a mobile app for a nursing community. The app will serve as a platform for nurses (RNs, LVNs, NPs, and New Grad Nurses) to network, share their experiences, and explore opportunities. Key Features: User Profiles: Allow users to create profiles with details such as name, role, specialty, and location. Community Feed: A space for users to post advice, questions, and updates, with options to like and comment. Networking Directory: A searchable list of users with filters for specialties and roles. Opportunities Section: A job board or event listing for career advancement. Messaging: Enable users to communicate privately or in groups. Requirements: Strong knowledge of Adalo or similar no-code platforms. Ability to integrate user authentication (email or social login). Experience in designing user-friendly interfaces. Excellent communication skills and the ability to collaborate on ideas. Deliverables: A fully functional and visually appealing mobile app. All project files, including app ownership and access. Optional: Support for app launch and initial user testing. Budget and Timeline: Budget: $2,000. Timeline: 6-8weeks Preferred Qualifications: Portfolio of apps built with Adalo or similar platforms. Experience working on community or networking apps. Instructions for Applicants: Please submit your proposal with the following: Examples of your previous Adalo projects. A brief outline of how you’d approach building this app. Your estimated timeline and budget.
title: Adalo App Developer Needed for Nurses' Networking and Community App

description: We’re seeking a talented and creative motion designer to help create video-based training courses for the wire & cable manufacturing industry. Each course consists of seven short videos (each under 5 minutes), blending animated visuals with real video footage to explain complex concepts in an engaging way. We have an established branding style and a streamlined process in place. You’ll work closely with our Manager of Education who oversees this project. You will be provided with fully developed scripts and supporting materials (e.g., footage, images, CAD drawings, and other graphics) so you can focus on creating our visually compelling and professional videos. Key Responsibilities: Design and animate visually engaging training videos that align with our established branding. Seamlessly integrate animations with provided video footage. Collaborate to ensure content clarity and quality. Manage revisions and feedback efficiently to deliver polished final videos. Requirements: Proven experience in motion design and video production (please include a portfolio or examples of your work). Strong proficiency in animation tools/software. Ability to adhere to established brand guidelines. Excellent communication skills and the ability to meet deadlines. Additional Details: Each course includes 7 videos. Our fixed budget is $2,500 per video. Your work would begin in 2025, after the holidays are behind us. This is an ongoing opportunity as we develop multiple courses. If you’re passionate about creating visually engaging learning content and have experience in motion design, we’d love to hear from you! Please include examples of relevant work in your application.
title: Motion Designer & Video Creator

description: We are a small but growing company currently using QuickBooks Desktop and looking to transition smoothly to QuickBooks Online. We need an experienced professional to guide us through the migration process, ensuring that our financial data is transferred accurately and that we’re fully set up to manage our accounting seamlessly online. Responsibilities: - Assess and analyze our current QuickBooks Desktop setup. - Develop a migration plan to move all financial data, including transactions, customer/vendor lists, and reports, from QuickBooks Desktop to QuickBooks Online. - Ensure data integrity and accuracy throughout the transition process. - Provide training and best practices for our team to effectively use QuickBooks Online post-migration. - Troubleshoot and resolve any issues that arise during the transition. Requirements: - Proven experience in migrating companies from QuickBooks Desktop to QuickBooks Online. - In-depth knowledge of both QuickBooks Desktop and QuickBooks Online platforms. - Familiarity with troubleshooting common migration issues. - Excellent communication skills and the ability to provide clear guidance and training. - Attention to detail to ensure all data is transferred correctly. Preferred Qualifications: - QuickBooks ProAdvisor certification. - Experience working with small businesses. - Availability to provide post-migration support, if needed. Project Scope: - One-time project, with the possibility of ongoing support depending on post-migration needs. - Flexible working hours, with the project timeline to be determined based on your recommendations and availability. If you’re an expert in QuickBooks migrations and can help make our transition smooth and stress-free, we’d love to hear from you! Please provide details of previous similar projects and your estimated timeline for completion. Budget: To be discussed based on scope and experience. We look forward to your proposals!
title: QuickBooks Migration Specialist

description: Looking to hire someone do monthly bookkeeping. I own multiple locations of a franchise....two locations currently and adding two to three per year. Each location will have its own QBO account. All the chart of accounts and everything is set up. All income comes in through Mindbody. I use cash basis accounting. Payroll is done through Paylocity. You do not need to do any payroll, invoicing or bill pay needed. I handle sales tax. The only complex part is I get a weekly invoice from the franchisor that needs to be "separated" into different accounts on the PNL. I'll have to email those directly to QBO or to you. The franchisor requires the books to be closed by the 10th of each month. The only report I need each month is the income statement. The franchisor will connect their software to each QBO account to pull their required data after the 10th of each month. I'm asumming there will be a setup or onboarding costs to get you going, but then a monthly fee for ongoing bookkeeping. My budget for ongoing monthly bookkeeping only is $250 per location. For reference, there is approximately 75 transactions the last 30 days.
title: Quickbook Online - Monthly Bookkeeping

title: Help Desk Specialist

description: We are seeking a dynamic, technology-savvy video content creator to join our team at CFOTech.com, an innovative leader in accounting software solutions. If you have a passion for creating educational and engaging video content that builds brand recognition and helps explain complex topics with clarity, we'd love to hear from you! Responsibilities: • Serve as the host and on-screen speaker for a variety of video projects designed to educate our audience about our software and services. • Collaborate with our team to implement pre-written scripts into polished video presentations. • Conduct professional-quality video captures (e.g., screen recordings) to visually demonstrate the software's functionality and key features. • Create videos that align with the branding and tone of CFOTech.com, ensuring content is both educational and engaging. • Utilize creative editing techniques to enhance video production quality and ensure content flows seamlessly. Examples of the type of work you'll produce: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=py4BOoipEAc https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOHOJdV9yio https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dw5AcNlJoyQ Requirements: • Proven experience in video content creation, hosting, or similar on-screen roles. • Familiarity with screen recording tools and video editing software. • Strong communication skills and the ability to present technical concepts in a clear and professional manner. • Ability to follow brand guidelines and maintain consistency in tone and presentation. • Creative problem-solver with a keen eye for visual storytelling. Join us in creating high-quality educational video content that makes a lasting impact and helps businesses succeed with CFOTech.com. Apply today to showcase your skills and become the face of our video content! https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=py4BOoipEAc https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WOHOJdV9yio https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dw5AcNlJoyQ The software script will be written by our team, but we will need a person to be the "host" and "on-screen speaker" for these videos. You must be familiar with doing video captures to implement into the video along with creating an educational video that helps brand our company--CFOTech.com.
title: Video Content Creator and On-Screen Host for Accounting Software Firm

description: Job Description: We are seeking a motivated and experienced Cold Caller to join our growing marketing agency. In this role, you will be responsible for reaching out to potential clients, generating leads, and setting appointments for our sales team. The ideal candidate has at least 1 year of cold calling experience, is goal-driven, and thrives in a fast-paced environment. Key Responsibilities: Make 150-180 outbound calls per day to potential clients with the goal of generating qualified leads and setting appointments. Effectively present the value of our marketing services, handle objections, and secure appointments. Communicate daily with the sales team, providing updates on call outcomes, lead status, and appointment details. Accurately log call details, outcomes, and follow-up actions in our CRM system. Work closely with the sales team to ensure a seamless transition of leads and appointments. Meet or exceed daily and weekly call and appointment-setting targets. Qualifications: Minimum 1+ year of cold calling or telemarketing experience, with a proven track record in lead generation and appointment setting. Fluent American accent with excellent verbal communication skills. Strong persuasion skills, with the ability to engage prospects quickly and effectively. Experience using CRM software (familiarity with [CRM name] is a plus). Ability to work independently, stay organized, and manage time efficiently. Self-motivated, goal-oriented, and results-driven. Compensation: $30 per appointment set (biweekly payouts). 30% commission on sales resulting from your appointments. $500 bonus for every 10 closed deals. Incentives and bonuses based on performance and meeting targets.
title: B2B Cold Caller for Marketing Campaigns

description: IT Global Services is a technology-driven solutions provider specializing in helping clients optimize their email communication strategies, improve deliverability, and enhance their online presence. We focus on providing advanced IT solutions to businesses across various industries, helping them build robust and effective systems. Position Overview: We are seeking an Email Deliverability Expert to join our team in a client-facing role. The ideal candidate will have deep expertise in inbox placement, email deliverability optimization, backend email automation, and reporting systems. You will be responsible for working directly with clients to build out email automation systems, configure DNS and reporting settings, and ensure top-tier inbox placement. This role will primarily focus on the backend infrastructure required to support high-performing email campaigns for various clients. Key Responsibilities: Inbox Placement & Deliverability Optimization: Work closely with clients to ensure email campaigns reach the inbox, using best practices for email authentication, reputation management, and spam filtering. API Integration & Email Sending: Leverage your coding skills to build and configure email sending systems through APIs (e.g., SendGrid, Amazon SES) for seamless integration. DNS & Reporting Configuration: Set up and maintain DNS records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) for clients to improve deliverability and protect against spoofing and phishing. Automated Email Flow Setup: Develop backend systems for automating client email campaigns, ensuring smooth workflows and optimized deliverability. Email Performance Reporting: Provide clients with deliverability insights by analyzing email performance metrics, offering solutions for continuous improvement, and generating detailed reports. Client Collaboration: Engage directly with clients to understand their email needs, deliverability challenges, and campaign objectives. Translate those into actionable, technical solutions. Ongoing Monitoring & Troubleshooting: Monitor email campaigns for deliverability issues, troubleshoot problems, and provide ongoing support to resolve any challenges related to inbox placement. Required Skills & Qualifications: Proven expertise in email deliverability, inbox placement, and spam filtering. Strong experience with email sending via APIs (SendGrid, Amazon SES, etc.). Advanced understanding of DNS records (SPF, DKIM, DMARC) and email authentication protocols. Hands-on experience building and managing automated email systems. Solid understanding of email campaign performance tracking, metrics analysis, and reporting. Ability to troubleshoot and resolve email deliverability issues efficiently. Strong client-facing communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Proficient in coding languages (e.g., HTML, CSS, JavaScript) for backend email integration. Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Preferred Qualifications: Experience working with high-volume email senders or enterprise-level email marketing systems. Background in working with clients in industries that rely heavily on email marketing, such as eCommerce, nonprofits, or political campaigns. Familiarity with email automation platforms and CRM systems (e.g., HubSpot, Salesforce, Marketo). Experience with email security protocols (e.g., DMARC, DKIM) and deliverability tools.
title: Email Deliverability Developer

description: Job Title: Licensed Architect for Innovative Warehouse Project in Georgia We are seeking a licensed architect in the state of Georgia to design and oversee the construction of a unique, futuristic, and progressive 20,000 square foot warehouse. The ideal candidate will possess the following qualifications and responsibilities: Qualifications: Valid Georgia Architect License Professional degree in architecture from a NAAB-accredited program Minimum of 3 years of practical experience in warehouse design and construction Strong portfolio showcasing innovative and progressive designs Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written Proficiency in architectural design software, particularly Revit and Lumion Responsibilities: Design a 20,000 square foot warehouse with a unique, futuristic, and progressive aesthetic Collaborate with the client to refine preliminary sketches and diagrams Develop comprehensive design plans, including schematic drawings and fixture plans Coordinate with city officials, fire department, and water company for necessary approvals Manage all aspects of the design process, from initial concept to detailed construction documents Provide twice-weekly progress updates via Zoom calls Complete the design phase within 2-3 months Ensure compliance with all relevant building codes and regulations Work efficiently and effectively to meet project deadlines Key Skills: Innovative design thinking Project management 3D modeling and rendering Building code knowledge Effective communication with clients and officials If you are a creative, efficient, and licensed architect in Georgia with a passion for progressive design, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity to shape the future of warehouse architecture
title: Experienced architectural engineer for innovative Buildings projects

We are a consignment and discount store that uses the database to keep all client information organized, separated and to issue payments. It has been fully built and designed but we need ongoing maintenance from time to time as well as updates and general questions. We're looking to have someone on call to help on an as needed basis. Currently we have a few small things that need adjusting. Thank you and I look forward to talking to you.
